official-title.#text:
To amend title IX of the Public Health Service Act to
		  revise the operations of the United States Preventive Services Task
		  Force.

, and in

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the

short-title.#text:
USPSTF Transparency and Accountability
			 Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Changes to United
			 States Preventive Services Task Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Health Service Act/s:915

header-in-text.#text:
United States Preventive Services Task
			 Force

text.#text:
by amending the
			 heading to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Health Service Act/s:915/ss:a/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may
				establish and periodically convene the
(in this section referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
United States Preventive Services Task
				Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall review the scientific evidence and new science related to the
				effectiveness and appropriateness of clinical preventive services for the
				purpose of developing recommendations for primary care clinicians and the
				health care community and updating previous clinical preventive
				recommendations.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
Public Health Service Act/s:915/ss:a/p:3
Public Health Service Act/s:915/ss:a/p:5
Public Health Service Act/s:915/ss:a/p:4..7
Public Health Service Act/s:915/ss:a/p:9..12
Public Health Service Act/s:915/ss:a/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				be composed of individuals that collectively have appropriate scientific
				expertise, including in fields of health sciences research, health economics,
				health promotion, disease prevention, and clinical care. The
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				include balanced representation of practicing primary and specialty care
				providers, patient and health care consumers, and relevant stakeholders from
				the medical products manufacturing community.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
United States Preventive Services Task Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall give persons an
				opportunity to nominate potential members. The

shall provide for the
				publication in the Federal Register of a request for comments on such members
				and shall provide a mechanism for persons to submit such comments through the
				official website of the Agency. The

shall consider any comments
				submitted in selecting the members of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
Public Health Service Act/s:915/ss:a/p:1
United States Preventive Services Task Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall publish one or more proposed
				research plans (in this subsection referred to as a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Health Service Act/s:915/ss:a/p:4/sp:A/cl:ii

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide for the
				publication in the Federal Register of a request for public comments on each
				plan and shall accept comments during a period of at least 60 days. Any final
				research plan shall be made available to the public and include a discussion of
				the comments received and responses to such comments. The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, may change such a research plan through the same
				process as applied to the initial adoption of such plan.

term.#tail:
)
				to guide the Task Force’s systematic review of the evidence. Each such plan
				shall include an analytic framework, key questions, and a literature search
				strategy or research approach, and shall incorporate the methodological
				guidelines developed under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall design and regularly
				update guidelines for proper methodological standards for incorporation into
				such research plans. Such guidelines shall include measures for appropriate
				validity, for risk adjustment, for timeliness, for input from relevant experts
				and peers in the respective communities, for accounting for all relevant
				subpopulations (including disparities by race, ethnicity, socioeconomic status,
				and geographic location), and for other health outcome measurements.

shall facilitate coordination and interaction with other agencies and
				departments in the creation of research plans (taking into consideration
				research and findings by other agencies and departments) and methodological
				standards under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Health Service Act/s:915/ss:a/p:4/sp:A/cl:ii
National Cancer Institute

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
National Institute on Minority Health and
				Health Disparities
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and the Patient-Centered Outcomes Research
				Institute.

shall
				make publicly available each draft evidence report and publish in the Federal
				Register a request for public comments on such reports. No such evidence report
				shall be published prior to it being reviewed by a panel of external subject
				matter experts that includes provider and patient representatives. Each such
				report shall include a description of the panel that conducted such review.
				Such description shall include information on each panel member, including
				name, academic degree (or degrees), affiliations, and related expertise.

shall make publicly available each draft recommendation and shall
				provide for the publication in the Federal Register of a request for comments
				and accept comments during a period of not less than 60 days.

shall consult with relevant stakeholders, including
				provider groups, practicing specialists that treat the specific disease under
				review, and relevant patient and disease advocacy organizations.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force

text.#text:
Before voting on a draft recommendation
				statement, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall make such comments received publicly
				available. Any final recommendation statement shall include a description of
				comments received on the draft recommendation statement and recommendations of
				other Federal agencies or organizations relating to the topic of the
				statement.

header.#text:
Public
				availability of comments and inclusion of description of comments in final
				statement

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall consider the impact
				of its recommendations on the health care community, whether a preventive
				service is beneficial for some individuals and the need to encourage a
				discussion of benefits and risks for those individuals, and how its specific
				assignment of a grade to a product or service may affect coverage and access to
				such product or service under Federal programs and private health insurance
				coverage.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
concludes
				that the current evidence is sufficient to assess the balance of benefits and
				risks of the product or service, and, on the basis of such evidence, recommends
				the product or service and determines that there is high certainty that the net
				benefit from the product or service is substantial.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
concludes
				that the current evidence is sufficient to assess the balance of benefits and
				risks of the product or service, and, on the basis of such evidence, recommends
				the product or service and determines that there is high certainty that the net
				benefit of the product or service is moderate or there is moderate certainty
				that the net benefit of the product or service is moderate to
				substantial.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
concludes
				that the current evidence is sufficient to assess the balance of benefits and
				risks of the product or service, and, on the basis of such evidence, does not
				make a recommendation of the product or service and clinicians may provide this
				product or service to selected patients depending on individual circumstances.
				However, for most individuals without signs or symptoms there is likely to be
				only a small benefit from this product or service.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
concludes
				that the current evidence is sufficient to assess the balance of benefits and
				risks of the product or service, and, on the basis of such evidence, recommends
				against the product or service and determines that there is moderate or high
				certainty that the product or service has no net benefit or that the harm of
				the product or service outweighs the benefits. Recommendations against a
				preventive service shall only be issued in concurrence with the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
after
				consultation with other Federal health agencies and relevant patient and
				provider groups.

concludes
				that the current evidence is not sufficient to assess the balance of benefits
				and risks of the product or service.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Preventive Services Task Force

				the grading system described in

makes a change in the grading system
				under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Health Service Act/s:915/ss:a/p:4/sp:E/cl:i

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall review and
				regrade the services previously classified within that grade. Such review and
				regrade may be done through an expedited process but any such change in grade
				shall not take effect before such review process is completed.
